issue.title: Update Multisense ladar and camera values to match hardware

content.raw:
For what its worth the current MultiSense SL firmware supports the following resolutions and framerates (https://support.carnegierobotics.com/hc/en-us/articles/202487666-Frame-rates-at-various-resolutions-and-disparity-search-windows-). With the new SGM firmware the MultiSense now supports disparity images at all resolutions.

On startup the default sensor resolution is 1024x544 at 10 FPS. It would make sense to make this the default in simulation as well. 

In addition the IMU data is now exposed in the current firmware. 1334Hz is the maximum frequency for accelerometer data and 800Hz is the maximum frequency for gyroscope data.
content.html:
For what its worth the current MultiSense SL firmware supports the following resolutions and framerates (https://support.carnegierobotics.com/hc/en-us/articles/202487666-Frame-rates-at-various-resolutions-and-disparity-search-windows-). With the new SGM firmware the MultiSense now supports disparity images at all resolutions.

On startup the default sensor resolution is 1024x544 at 10 FPS. It would make sense to make this the default in simulation as well.

In addition the IMU data is now exposed in the current firmware. 1334Hz is the maximum frequency for accelerometer data and 800Hz is the maximum frequency for gyroscope data.
